name: HackOverflow 4.0
tagline: A 36 hour sprint of innovation, code, and collaboration
organizer: Pillai HOC College of Engineering & Technology (PHCET)

phcet.description: Discover a state-of-the-art educational experience at Pillai HOC College of Engineering and Technology! Our expansive 14-acre campus provides a dynamic learning environment, boasting a 3,000 sq-ft facility equipped with spacious classrooms, cutting-edge laboratories, and contemporary computer setups. Immerse yourself in innovation with access to our extensive library, offering a wealth of resources to fuel your academic pursuits.

computer_department.description: Our Computer Engineering Department, proudly approved by AICTE and DTE, holds NBA accreditation and an 'A+' Grade from NAAC. We aim to produce proficient, ethical, and innovative graduates. Emphasizing both theoretical and practical aspects, we prioritize problem-solving and eco-conscious research. Join us for globally recognized standards in education, shaping socially responsible and technically adept computer engineers.

about.hackoverflow: Get ready for HackOverflow 4.0! Following the success of the third edition in March 2025 at PHCET's campus, this National-level hackathon is back, attracting brilliant students from across India. Building on the triumph of its predecessor, HackOverflow 4.0 offers a dynamic platform for participants to showcase exceptional skills and ignite creativity in the evolving tech world.

gdg_phcet.name: Google Developers Group, PHCET
gdg_phcet.description: The Google Developers Group (GDG), PHCET is a community for students interested in developing their skills in Google Developer technologies. The club holds activities to support students' academic success, including study jams, solution challenges and more.

csi_phcet.name: Computer Society of India, PHCET
csi_phcet.description: The CSI PHCET Student Club is a student-led community at PHCET that aims to bring together students with an interest in technology and latest industry trends. The club conducts a variety of events and activities, including webinars, coding sessions and seminars to support the academic growth and development of its members.

cybersecurity_club.name: Cybersecurity Club, PHCET
cybersecurity_club.description: The Cybersecurity Club, initiated by the Department of Computer Engineering, aims to build strong awareness and practical skills in the field of information security. The club has successfully organized events and workshops focused on ethical hacking, network security, and cyber awareness, helping students understand real-world security challenges and defense mechanisms.

other_communities.description: In addition to these clubs, PHCET also has other computer science rated communities such as Geeks For Geeks- PHCET, AI and Data Analysis club which focus on educating students about the latest software trends and AI/Data analysis technologies respectively. These clubs provide students with a wealth of opportunities to explore their interest and develop their skills in variety of computer science related fields

reasons.title: Real World Problem Solving
reasons.description: Tackle real-world challenges and create impactful solutions

reasons.title: Networking Opportunities
reasons.description: Connect with like-minded tech enthusiasts and industry professionals

reasons.title: Mentor Guided Innovation
reasons.description: Get guidance from experienced mentors and industry experts

reasons.title: Networking & Jamming Sessions
reasons.description: Participate in collaborative sessions and build lasting connections

reasons.title: Unforgettable Goodies
reasons.description: Win exciting prizes, swags, and memorable experiences

transport.description: Bus facility for pickup from Pillai College of Engineering, Panvel

accommodation.description: Free accommodation facility within the Campus

food.description: Daily 3 meals (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner) available within Campus

skill_development.title: Save Money, Master new skills
skill_development.description: Join our group and you might win special discounts and get access to courses that helps you master new skills.

surprise_gifts.title: Fun Surprise Gifts
surprise_gifts.description: When you join our events or do fun things with us, we have surprise gifts waiting just for you.

free_goodies.title: Free Goodies for Everyone
free_goodies.description: Just for being part of Hackathon, everyone gets free goodies. It's our way of saying thanks for being with us.

certificates.title: Certificates for All Participants and Winners
certificates.description: Not only do you get cool stuff, but every participant also gets a certificate. Plus, the winning team gets a special certificate for their awesome achievement!

process.title: Registration
process.description: The registration fee is set at Rs 500 per team member, and each team can consist of 3 to 4 members. Please ensure accurate information is provided during registration.

process.title: Project Idea Submission
process.description: Each team is required to submit a comprehensive project idea that aligns with the theme of the Hackathon.

process.title: Evaluation Criteria
process.description: We will evaluate the project ideas based on creativity, technical feasibility, and relevance to the theme.

process.title: Selection Announcement
process.description: Shortlisted teams will receive detailed instructions and further steps on their registered email address.

process.title: Payment Confirmation
process.description: Selected teams are required to pay the registration fee of Rs 500 per team member to secure their team's position in hackathon.

heads.name: Parth Bhoir — the server guy who maintains the home server, and the entire HackOverflow infrastructure is sustained on that server
Ashutosh Chavan - if 'aab toh paise hi paisa hoga' was a person
Midhun Mohandas - also know as 'i am so tall , i am very tall' guy
Advait Patil - also knows as ADY the Blender guy

faqs.question: Can I participate if I'm a beginner?
faqs.answer: Yes! HackOverflow welcomes participants of all skill levels.

faqs.question: How to register for the offline track?
faqs.answer: Registration is open from December 25 to January 31. Visit the official website to register. The registration fee is Rs 500 per team member.

faqs.question: What is the maximum number of members allowed in a team?
How long is the hackathon going to last?
faqs.answer: The hackathon lasts for 36 hours across 3 days (March 11-13, 2026).

faqs.question: What are the perks every participant is going to get?
faqs.answer: Participants get access to mentorship, networking opportunities, meals, free accommodation within campus, transport facilities, certificates, free goodies, and chances to win from a prize pool of ₹100,000+.

faqs.question: Will there be any mentorship sessions?
faqs.answer: Yes, there will be mentorship sessions throughout the hackathon with industry experts and experienced faculty.

faqs.question: What food arrangements are in place?
faqs.answer: Daily 3 meals (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner) will be provided during the event within the campus.

faqs.question: Is accommodation provided?
faqs.answer: Yes, free accommodation facility is available within the campus for all participants.

faqs.question: Is transportation provided?
faqs.answer: Yes, bus facility for pickup from Pillai College of Engineering, Panvel is available.

theme.note: Participants are free to choose their own problem statements in any domain. However, after the theme is revealed, participants must align their projects with the theme by making minor modifications to ensure relevance.
